availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Grier (Carter County, farmer and Provost Marshall)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and Provost Marshall. Ohio native. Married to Amanda N. Grier. Father of Harriet A. Grier, Ida Grier, Luwilla Grier, Sophia Grier, and Ella Grier. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Provost Marshall in Greenup, Kentucky in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 34.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Barton County, Lamar, p. 30.
Find A Grave, "William C. Grier (1819-1881)," Memorial #80461743, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80461743# (accessed December 12, 2018).
